lines.content: Bob is a lightweight, text-based task manager designed to help you organize your tasks efficiently. Inspired by the quote:
> ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì [David Allen](https://gettingthingsdone.com/)
Bob frees your mind from the burden of remembering tasks. It‚Äôs:
*   Easy to learn: No steep learning curve.
*   **FAST SUPER FAST** to use: Get things done in seconds.
3.  Add your tasks using simple commands.
4.  Let Bob manage your tasks for you üòâ.
And the best part? It‚Äôs FREE! üéâ
-   Add tasks with deadlines, events, or todos.
-   Mark tasks as done or undone.
-   Delete tasks you no longer need.
Here‚Äôs how you can use Bob:
This project incorporates code and/or ideas from the following sources:
*   **Code Reuse:**  The `DialogBox` `MainWindow` classes is adapted from work by Wang Haitao iP.
*   **AI Assistance:** Gemini and DeepSeek were used for generating initial drafts of Javadoc documentation.

Bob is a lightweight, text-based task manager designed to help you organize your tasks efficiently. Inspired by the quote:
> ‚ÄúYour mind is for having ideas, not holding them.‚Äù ‚Äì [David Allen](https://gettingthingsdone.com/)
Bob frees your mind from the burden of remembering tasks. It‚Äôs:
*   Easy to learn: No steep learning curve.
*   **FAST SUPER FAST** to use: Get things done in seconds.
3.  Add your tasks using simple commands.
4.  Let Bob manage your tasks for you üòâ.
And the best part? It‚Äôs FREE! üéâ
-   Add tasks with deadlines, events, or todos.
-   Mark tasks as done or undone.
-   Delete tasks you no longer need.
Here‚Äôs how you can use Bob:
This project incorporates code and/or ideas from the following sources:
*   **Code Reuse:**  The `DialogBox` `MainWindow` classes is adapted from work by Wang Haitao iP.
*   **AI Assistance:** Gemini and DeepSeek were used for generating initial drafts of Javadoc documentation.

* Represents a command to add a deadline task.
* Parses the command arguments to extract the description and deadline.
* @param arguments The command arguments string.  Expected format: "deadline <description> /by <time>"
* @throws BobException If the arguments are invalid or missing.
throw new BobException("Did you forget your '/by' command? So un-attentive!");
throw new BobException("Invalid deadline format. Use: 'deadline <description> /by <time>'");
* Creates a new Deadline task, adds it to the task list, saves the updated list, and displays a message.
* @return        null. This command doesn't return a string to be displayed.  The UI handles output.
* @throws BobException If an error occurs during execution (e.g., saving the task list).
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws BobException {
TaskList.add(task); // Assuming TaskList.add is a static method
Ui.appendResponse("You better remember to do it or I'll spank you"); // Consider a more professional message

* Custom exception class for Bob, the sassy bot. Includes personalized error messages.
* Constructs a new BobException with no detail message.
* Constructs a new BobException with a sassy message.
* @param message The error message. Make it sassy!
* Constructs a new BobException with a cause and a sassy message.
* @param message The error message. Make it sassy!
* @param cause   The cause of the exception.
"Oh dear, it seems you've made a boo-boo. ",
"My circuits are overheating with this nonsense. ",
"Looks like someone needs a little help. ",
"Houston, we have a problem. And by 'we,' I mean 'you.' "
". I'm sure you can figure it out... eventually.",
". Don't look at me like that.",
". Consult the manual. Or don't. Whatever.",
". Maybe take a break. Or a long vacation.",
". It's not rocket science. Unless it is.",
". You're welcome.", // Even when it's not their fault!
". I'd explain it, but you probably wouldn't understand.",
". Don't worry, I won't tell anyone... probably.",
".  Perhaps a cup of tea and a rethink?",
".  This is going to require some serious brainpower. Yours."
* Returns a string representation of this BobException. This overrides the default behavior
* to return just the message (including the sassy additions), rather than the class name and message.
* @return A string representation of this BobException (just the message).
return getMessage(); // This will now include the sassy prefix/suffix
